sub_title: Associate Legal Officer at International Criminal Court
summary: Specialties: human rights training, legal capacity building, legal research, drafting, women's rights, children's rights, international human rights law

school.name: St. John's University School of Law, New York City

profile_positions.description: Launched and maintain an Early Alert System in collaboration with a focal point from each Judicial Division in order to ensure the accurate flow of information between Chambers and the Public Information Section; For all eight situations currently before the Court, keep the Public Information and Outreach Units apprised of important judicial developments; Advise the ICC spokesperson on the content of press releases; Inform staff in the field of important judicial developments and ensure they are prepared to disseminate correct information; Prepare Q&As on judicial developments to be used as outreach tools in the field; Devise and oversee the content of workshops and seminars, and explore possibilities for new information opportunities, with the legal and academic communities in ICC situation countries; To enhance an understanding of the ICC amongst various groups visiting HQ, in particular those coming from situation related countries, situations under preliminary examination, and legal communities, fulfil speaking engagements and make presentations on the Rome Statute and the work of the Court; Research open sources and hold informational meetings with third parties in order to conduct a preliminary assessment of information needs and existing local structures in Mali; Prepare regular reports laying out the local context, media trends, and impact of decisions on the most affected communities for consumption by the appropriate ICC office or related body; In collaboration with the audio-visual team, develop a new outreach tool for TV and radio to be used in all situation countries.
profile_positions.title: Associate Legal Officer

profile_positions.description: Design, draft and implement an advocacy strategy to achieve support for the ICC; Draft regular briefing papers on relevant political developments in the DRC and the region, including analysis of developments in ratification and implementation of the Rome Statute; Keep abreast of all judicial proceedings before the Court and inform the population in the DRC about relevant developments; Meet with government officials, parliamentarians and other key persons to promote the ICC’s goals at the national level; Facilitate meetings on ICC issues between national NGOs and government representatives; Organise ICC-related outreach activities with local partners, including women’s groups, students, and members of civil society; Organise and conduct seminars and training workshops for the legal community and journalists in order to build their capacities to promote the ICC; Coordinate the Court's strategies and activities with other ICC officials in the field; Manage a staff of five Assistant Outreach Officers based in Kinshasa and Bunia and plan, coordinate and monitor their work; Organise and conduct field missions throughout Ituri and North and South Kivu; Serve as media liaison officer and act as local spokesperson, organise media relations, hold press conferences, conduct media briefings and interviews; Draft detailed monthly reports on all outreach activities conducted in the DRC; Draft the outreach section of the ICC’s weekly newsletter; Submit  information and inputs to Headquarters for preparation of the yearly budget programme and manage the budgetary and administrative aspects of the field offices, including the preparation of monthly financial reports; Conduct evaluation studies on outreach activities in the DRC and draft reports including statistics, trends and impact analysis; Draft the annual report for the DRC; Represent the Outreach Unit at internal and external meetings, including meetings of the Assembly of States Parties.
profile_positions.title: Field Outreach Coordinator for the Democratic Republic of Congo

profile_positions.description: Conducted research pertaining to the legal issues on appeal, including on the role of victims and witnesses before the Court; Prepared memoranda on legal and factual issues; Drafted decisions and judgments; Maintained an electronic and physical filing system for all documents relating to appeals; Prepared the participation in Court hearings of the judge, including preparing relevant documentation and speaking notes; Attended Court sessions to provide immediate advice to the judge; Informed and advised the judge on all proceedings before the Court; Maintained a calendar and time-line of deadlines for submissions by the parties and participants.
profile_positions.title: Associate Legal Officer

profile_positions.description: Working Languages: French, Italian and English: Drafted letters to governments on behalf of victims of human rights abuses committed or supported by government actors; Created a daily press review of news from the European Parliament; Researched and wrote reports on various areas of European Union Law and gave presentations on Competition and IT Law; Acted as translator for the Italian delegate to the CCBE; Liaised between the Secretariat and the delegates of the CCBE's Member Bars, and kept the delegates up to date on the activities of the Secretariat; Organised conferences between the Member Bars and the Secretariat; Responded to general requests for information from the public and representatives of the Member Bars; Maintained up-to-date information on the composition of delegations.

profile_positions.description: Represented asylum applicants in immigration court under the Violence Against Women Act and the Victims of Trafficking and Violence Protection Act.  Interviewed asylum victims, conducted fact research, and performed legal research. Argued and won cases in which my clients were granted asylum.
profile_positions.title: Advocate

profile_positions.description: Managed a project on children born of wartime sexual violence; Interviewed victims of wartime rape to ascertain the types of assistance that could best serve them and their children; Conducted meetings with government ministers and NGOs to discuss the establishment of psycho-social assistance and social inclusion projects; Used data collected during the interviews to draft proposed amendments to the Bosnian Law on Principles of Social Protection, Protection of Civil Victims of War, and Protection of Families with Children, which lays down the prerequisites needed to qualify for the status of “civil victim of war”;  Held follow-up meetings with the same victims in order to provide counseling and support; After speaking with the victims at length, worked in close cooperation with a local NGO to prepare a report outlining the victims' needs, then presented this report to government ministers along with the proposed amendments to the above-mentioned law; Analysed case materials from the ICTY relating to wartime sexual violence, along with wider jurisprudence on the matter of compensatory claims; Wrote a report on de jure compliance by Bosnia-Herzegovina with the U.N. Sex Trafficking Protocol, with a focus on the government’s standards for protecting and assisting domestic victims of trafficking; Proposed amendments to the Bosnian domestic sex trafficking legislation.
